topic.title: Cluster Aggregation Switches
topic.shortdesc: For clusters consisting of one more pods, the architecture uses either of the following for aggregation switches:

body.p: The choice depends on the initial size and planned scaling. The Force10 S4810-based aggregation design is preferred for lower cost and medium scalability. This design can handle up to six racks or two pods. The Z9000 is recommended for larger deployments.

Like the ToR switches, the aggregation switches are also connected in pairs using VLT. The uplink from each S4810 ToR switch to the aggregation pair is 80Gb, using a pair of 40G interfaces Since both S4810â€™s connect to the aggregation pair, there is a collective bandwidth of 160G available from each rack.
